thread.title: W-MU volleyball falls to Mediapolis at home
thread.title_full: W-MU volleyball falls to Mediapolis at home

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: W-MU volleyball falls to Mediapolis at home
text:
W-MU volleyball falls to Mediapolis at home Oct 02, 2015 Photo by: Dana Royer Winfield-Mt. Union’s Sophie Kongable goes down to one knee to dig a ball in Thursday’s game against Mediapolis. Also pictured is Cassidy Lennie (10). 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
WINFIELD — The Winfield-Mt. Union volleyball team had a four-game win streak snapped at home on Thursday night when the Wolves matched up against SEISC tournament champion Mediapolis. The Wolves improved a little in each game, but the Bulldogs were able to roll to a 3-0 victory (25-7, 25-11, 25-15). 
Lexee Hartsock had a good day offensively, racking up four kills on 13 attempts for a .231 kill efficiency. Pearl Krieger-Coble had three kills and Hannah Buffington, Caitlin Jamison, Sophie Kongable and Cassidy Lennie each had one. 
Lennie led in digs with 11. C. Jamison had 10 digs and nine assists. Kongable had seven digs, Lauren Jamison had five, Kara Wade had three, Buffington had two and Krieger-Coble had one. 
As a team, the Wolves went 32-35 on serves for a .914 serve efficiency. C. Jamison had the best day, going 9-9. Kongable went 7-7, Wade went 6-6, L. Jamison and Krieger-Coble each went 4-4, Lennie went 1-4 and Kenzie Scott went 1-1. 
The Wolves fell to 12-12 with the loss and will be competing in the New London tournament this Saturday.
